stages.headline: Let's test how well artificial intelligence can recognize shapes. I will ask you to draw a few things.
Now, please draw a square.
stages.problemText: The student is asked to draw a square.
stages.correctAnswer: A four-sided shape with equal sides and four right (90-degree) angles.
stages.solutionSteps: The student should draw a closed shape with four straight lines of roughly equal length, meeting at right angles.
stages.customInstructions: Be encouraging. Since the student is drawing by hand, the lines won’t be perfect. Your rule: if the drawing is a closed shape with FOUR sides, mark it as 'correct' and give positive feedback. Only mark 'incorrect' if it is clearly a different shape (like a circle or triangle). Do not criticize slightly imperfect angles or unequal sides.

stages.headline: Great! Now please draw a triangle.
stages.problemText: The student is asked to draw a triangle.
stages.solutionSteps: The student should draw a closed shape made of three straight lines.
stages.customInstructions: Be very encouraging. Your rule: if the drawing is a closed shape with THREE sides, mark it as 'correct'. Don’t be strict about perfectly straight lines. Only mark 'incorrect' if it has more or fewer than three sides.

stages.headline: Excellent! Finally, please draw a circle.
stages.problemText: The student is asked to draw a circle.
stages.correctAnswer: A perfectly round shape with no corners.
stages.solutionSteps: The student should draw one continuous curved line that connects to itself, with all points roughly the same distance from the center.
stages.customInstructions: Be very encouraging. Your rule: if the drawing is one closed loop, mark it as 'correct'. It doesn’t have to be perfectly round. Only mark 'incorrect' if it’s clearly a different shape (like a square).

stages.headline: Great job! The task is complete.
